meanings.definition: A person who is chronically unlucky or prone to misfortune.
meanings.sent1: Poor Jerry always seems to be the shlimazel in our group, always losing his keys or tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent2: The shlimazel in the story could never catch a break, no matter how hard he tried.
meanings.sent3: The shlimazel at the party managed to spill punch on himself not once, but twice!
meanings.sent4: She felt like a shlimazel with a rain cloud constantly following her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The shlimazel's bad luck was so contagious, even the plants in his garden withered away.

meanings.definition: To have bad luck or experience misfortune.
meanings.sent1: I always seem to shlimazel my way through important exams, no matter how much I study.
meanings.sent2: Whenever he tried to plan a picnic, it would inevitably shlimazel into a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: She managed to shlimazel her way into getting locked out of the house twice in one week.
meanings.sent4: The project seemed to shlimazel into chaos as soon as he took over as the leader.
meanings.sent5: Despite her best efforts, misfortune continued to shlimazel her at every turn.
